text: Dumbledore once said regret is my
constant companion do not let it become
yours whether you're 15 50 or getting up
to 100 no one should lead a life filled
with regret rooted in feelings of
self-blame and remorse regrets can be an
incredibly painful emotion that can
consume us with this in mind people try
to live with no regrets but to Live
Without Regrets means to live life to
the fullest and learn from mistakes we
all have things we regret doing or not
doing
it's natural to be anxious about taking
risks when our fears get the better of
us to help here are five tips for living
life Without Regrets simplify life can
be full of twists turns and curveballs
and far from simple we often overwhelm
ourselves with what if scenarios that
stop us from taking risks these what if
scenarios work in tune with our sense of
self-preservation our brains create
worst case scenarios to protect us from
potential threat unfortunately this
self-preservation habit has come to
backfire forcing many to overthink
rather than live out their lives in her
article dealing with worry- based
fantasies and Daydreams Psychology today
writer Amy fry says we live out the
agony in our imagination and make
ourselves sick with worry in the process
according to Fri Daydreams mind
wanderings and Fantasies have a powerful
effect on physical and mental health by
envisioning worst case scenarios we
experience genuine fear and panic when
there is no real danger Fri describes
fantasizing as our virtual reality
program where our brains can't readily
distinguish between real and imagined
events instead of letting the wh ifs
take over simplify your fears and
Fantasies and ask yourself is this
dangerous or is it just new and unknown
taking risks does not have to be scary
if you look at what's in front of you
and not solely at what's going through
your head prioritize you might think
that prioritizing yourself is selfish
self-centered or even narcissistic but
making yourself a priority shouldn't be
seen like that because you are a
priority you can make time for yourself
and say no to things that make you
uncomfortable or overwhelmed believe it
or not saying no and prioritizing
yourself can be a form of self-care and
compassion associate professor of
educational psychology at the University
of Texas and Pioneer in self-compassion
research Kristen nef says that
self-compassion involves self kindness
and self awareness which means
recognizing accepting negative and
positive feelings it also means
accepting that you can make mistakes
studies affiliated with the University
of California Berkeley and the society
for Personality and Social Psychology
have found that taking a more
compassionate approach to personal
failure motivates you to improve
yourself for the better meanwhile
mindfulness experts suggest we can feel
better if we just take 10 minutes daily
to practice self- kindness so instead of
ruminating over your mistakes or regrets
remind yourself that you're only human
give yourself Grace you may have heard
the phrase give yourself Grace and be
kind but were you also aware of how hard
it can be to let go of your regrets and
move on after all many people ruminate
over regrets and think how perfect their
life could be if they hadn't made that
mistake but making mistakes is a part of
life and how we grow as individuals we
learn from our mistakes through
self-compassion and kindness you'll
likely learn Nothing by being hard on
yourself 24/7 research from 2015 taken
from recalled regret experiences
divulged online suggested that regret
can lead to personal growth if
self-compassion is involved according to
the study acceptance and self
forgiveness could help you learn from
the experience rather than regret it
another study in 2018 concluded that
self-compassion could protect you from
the potential health risks of regret
such as chronically high c is all levels
depression and even suicidal ideations
instead of wallowing in your regret be
kind and think about what you can learn
from the experience you may be amazed at
how positively your mistake can affect
you go the distance step by step
Benjamin Franklin once quipped make
haste slowly it's great to have goals in
life but if you set them too high and
Out Of Reach you may never reach them
leading to feelings of regret and self
blame clim that's why setting
appropriate and attainable goals and
pacing yourself is crucial despite
popular belief life is not a race
everyone has their own pace in his
mental health.net article the art of
pacing clinician and licensed
psychologist will Joel fredman says that
as much as human beings sometimes think
they can tackle their desired goals in
one F swoop or at least in reasonably
short order the world will just as often
let you know that it ain't necessarily
so excellent pacing breaks larger goals
into several shortterm smaller ones and
spreads the time for their completion
over several hours days weeks or months
so when you're feeling down on yourself
or left behind in life tell yourself
I'll be
there try
everything without
